Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scarab
Description: An element of a composite necklace comprising five other scarabs and a variety of amulets. This particular one is small, very succinctly carved and misshapen on the left side: schematised head and clypeus, prothorax indicated by two lateral incisions and the legs by a circle. The reverse bears many prophylactic signs: Ankh ("life"), wadj ("green") and nefer ("beautiful, good, perfect").
